website_summaries.verdict: The durable outdoor stove gets even easier to use courtesy of an easy-on switch, eliminating the need for a match or lighter.
pros: Stove puts out a lot of heat, and meals can be prepared quickly
The edges aren't sharp like on some other brands
Great for both newbie and seasoned campers, as it doesn’t take up a lot of room
cons: Temperature and flame adjustment could use some finessing
The stove's metal feet tend to slide on smooth surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Valve misaligned so far the tank won't screw in!
customer_reviews.text: Either this is a knock-off or the quality control is abysmal. The valve stem you screw the tank into is so far off I had to bend it a full 1/4" to center it in the hole enough for the propane tank to screw in. I hope it's still safe, but I guess my family will be the first to find out! On second thought, maybe it's time to buy one at full price from REI.
customer_reviews.author: jffielde

customer_reviews.title: Good stove but the self igniter is not good
customer_reviews.text: Its light and its what I was looking for. The only reason I gave it a 3 star is because the self ignition button does not work. I think it worked once and then it didn't work again. I kept it because I love the stove itself and just use a lighter or a match.
customer_reviews.author: Dora

customer_reviews.title: Lots of BTUs
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 2 week camping adventure to Montana with our teardrop. The stove puts out some power. The first batch of pancakes...well...they were a bit overdone. Once I got a sense of the amount of heat the stove created, the cooking went much better. Easy to carry and store. Connecting propane tank is simple. Wind guards are easy to use and effective. One note of caution, the cover/top gets very hot when cooking. The stove did slide around a bit when on a picnic table. Wish Coleman would put some sort of heat resistant rubberized feet on the bottom to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: cinva24

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered this stove for a camping trip and thank god i checked to make sure it worked bc the regulator that attaches the stove to the gas doesn’t even fit into the hole so i can’t screw it on. Looks like it was very cheaply made and clearly not checked. i’m very disappointed and stressin bc now i need to get another stove asap before my trip. i’d give it 0 stars if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ayala

customer_reviews.title: Basically solid, prefer old starter
customer_reviews.text: My Scout troop has used the previous version of this stove for over 10 years, so in the neighborhood of 100 weekend camp outs. Our original four are falling apart and one had its igniter fail, but I would consider them to have given good service. This new one is basically the same, so I expect it to be mostly fine, but I have to say that I hate the push button igniter. The problem is that you have to push it hard enough to move the stove, so you have to hold the back of the stove with your other hand. If you’ve been cooking, the back can be hot,
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Brown

customer_reviews.title: where is the quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my boy scout troop. As other people have mentioned, you cannot regulate the heat very much. The stove is pretty cheaply made. The lid gets caught on the burner or something when closed. Have to push out a little in order to open. Really disappointed in Coleman. I thought I would be getting a little better quality for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: MarkusR

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazon delivered this fast to my mom in Puerto Rico, post hurricane Maria in September 2017. Having no electricity she was in desperate need for a stove like this. It was a life saver for her. She found its performance to be exceptional, way better than her older and smaller unit. She is thrilled in owning this product and said will make sure to care for it in hopes it will last her a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Agustín

customer_reviews.title: Made In China
customer_reviews.text: Well, at least this Coleman stove arrived in useable condition. Once upon a time the name 'Coleman' meant the highest quality and MADE IN THE USA. Those times are gone. There is really nothing wrong with this stove, unlike the one I bought last year that was warped - GREAT Quality Control guys!. I'm just offended that they moved their production to China and cheapened the line.
customer_reviews.author: James T. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Built CHEAP
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Triton to replace my old Coleman dual Insta start stove that i owned for 10 years. The Triton has fallen apart after about 3 months. It was assembled poorly. They use tiny screws to attach the burners to the bottom of the stove. These rattled out, got lost, and caused the stove to come apart and not function. Would never buy again. As a matter of fact, i purchased the Camp Chef Everest instead. Coleman lost my business.
customer_reviews.author: joseph from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Quick breakfast while RoadTripping
customer_reviews.text: An easy 2-burner stove for cooking up eggs/sausage off the back of your truck or Picnic area. We knew the restaurants would be a bit iffy on our last trip, so we packed up a dozen eggs, spicy/cheddar sausages, boiling pan and Spanish coffee pot (Pilone). Best coffee on the road, eating outdoors and saving time getting going (as well as a few bucks). The temperature control is pretty much 'High' and 'Really High', so don't plan on getting fancy with your recipe without some practice beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flame control valves are very poorly engineered
customer_reviews.text: The flame control valve is basically a bolt and it is very hard to adjust the flame. if you are not careful and don't close it completely you will wake up to an empty propane tank. I am very disappointed, other than that it is a great stove. You have to disconnect the propane from the stove when not in use so as not to drain the propane tank. I cannot believe that they are so cheap on the flame control valve. Even the cheap table top propane grills have this feature. Sadly I am past the return window or I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Randal Tanabe

customer_reviews.title: My coffe pot is too tall in the wind.
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I didn't get the cheaper one for $43.88 that's 10% weaker and doesn't have wind resistant burners. I guess it'd work OK on short pans and great inside an RV with a mild exhaust fan. But it's labeled for outside where a very mild wind seemed to gust 90% of the heat away from my 28 cup coffee pot! So I managed to sheild it with a 18 x 20" part off my truck. So, now all I need to do is get a really serious windscreen about 24 x 18 x 18 Inches and weight it all down because I really like the breeze outside.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen I. White

customer_reviews.title: Bigfoot Researcher
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be so easy to use, and with the Large Coleman Carry Case (not the one in the link associated - it's too small), it's easy to carry along with the 1 lb propane bottles. Again, if you're getting the carry case, Get the LARGE Coleman Carry Case. Sleek design, and easy to use after a full night of research, and waiting on that first pot of coffee & powdered scrambled eggs or instant oatmeal. I usually just open a can of hearty soup for dinner, haven't really gone beyond that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fabian

customer_reviews.title: Liked the push-button starter and clean burning
customer_reviews.text: vs my ancient coleman two burner which is very similar, but the instant-on doesn't work so well any more on that one. The one complaint, which others have mentioned, is that it is very hard to get a low stable flame. It wants to "walk back" a bit after you've let go of the knob, and to get a simmer takes a fine touch and some patience. I burned some crepes before getting it right.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Camping
customer_reviews.text: I knew what I was getting when I purchased this, there fore I knew what to expect when attempting to regulate the gas flow. I did not have any problems. Gas will either be on full blast, or low if you crack the knob just past on. I don't mind a full blast flame as I'm usually in a hurry to make lunch at the campsite and need a hot flame to warm up my cast iron pans.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Cannot use
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2017, not tried to use till last week. Cannot get regulator to screw in. Looks like connection on stove is not positioned correct. Looks like quality is not a concern. Will have to contact Coleman to see what can be done. Check your items when they arrive. I could not cook for my family on our trip cause the stove would not work.
customer_reviews.author: Jason V.

customer_reviews.title: Consistent performer
customer_reviews.text: This stove, with an electric start, starts the first time every time. It produces a good amount of heat, but this is somewhat difficult to regulate at the low end. It boils water and cooks quickly. It’s easy to clean and folds down to a manageable and compact size. My only complaint is that the side wind screens are very thin and may not stand the test of time. Time will tell! I had a Coleman stove 30+ years ago and it seemed much sturdier. Overall, however, I’m happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SSWisc

customer_reviews.title: I finally broke down and decided to get a bigger stove than my Jetboil for these trips and I am very happy with this Coleman so
customer_reviews.text: Usually I am a campfire/backcountry stove cook, but my fiancé has not done much backpacking yet so we have been easing him in with car camping. I finally broke down and decided to get a bigger stove than my Jetboil for these trips and I am very happy with this Coleman so far! Easy to set up and use. Only wish there was a better way to carry it than having to opt for the carrying case. Would be nice to have some sort of suitcase-like handle for easier transport. Haven't had any of the flukes I've read about in some other reviews, would definitely recommend this to others!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Gelder

customer_reviews.title: Great stove, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is overall an excellent stove. Lightweight, compact and durable. Lighting the burner with the push button start is incredibly easy. The only thing I would change is I wish that you could control the temperature range a bit more, it pretty much is either high or low flame and not much in between. But it has worked wonderfully for us for all different types of meals from pancakes to pasta to curry. Great stove, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Gunderson

customer_reviews.title: Food on the table
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mom and aunt. They live in California and all their appliances are electric. They have been subjected to rolling black outs due to all of the fires and preventative shut down of the electrical grid. I don’t have “generator money” but to keep the ladies at least fed at home this gas grill was perfect. They are able to put it together and pack it away themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Verburg

customer_reviews.title: Works like a champ
customer_reviews.text: As a user of white-gas (coleman fuel) stoves for decades, I was very reluctant to go to propane due to concerns about disposability of fuel container, always having to have extra containers around, and ability to use at cold temps. Well, I only use this car-camping in spring/summer/fall, so outdoor temp is not a problem. Very easy to light, a big plus over white gas stoves. Convenience factor is high. But still concerned about disposing the used fuel canisters, will have to take to hazardous waste.
customer_reviews.author: BeInNature

customer_reviews.title: Great outdoor or table top camping stove.
customer_reviews.text: Great table top 2 burner propane stove. Used it on a recent camping trip and it worked great. Burners boiled water in a 3 cup pot in less than 5 mins. Only minor thing was the burner controls are not fine tunable for flame intensity. High and medium were the only choices. Not a problem, just a matter of lack of a low setting. Still would buy the stove, regardless.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: Starter button gets stuck in and the knobs that adjust the heat on the burners are now not working :-(
customer_reviews.text: Only used it once but so far so good! Seems like a great little stove. I like it that its lightweight. I would like to update my review. After 3 camping trips the starter button keeps getting stuck inside which always makes me panic a little. My husband keeps having to adjust it with tools to try to keep it from happening. And now the other knobs that adjust the burners are not working leaving it stuck on high. Very dissapointed in the design. Its past the return window now so I guess we are stuck but can't recommend it for those reasons and would never buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: She_ra_ramm

customer_reviews.title: good stove
customer_reviews.text: used it for the first time camping and it did not disappoint. The power went out one day at home while I was canning my tomatoes so I got this thing out of the camper and fired it up. It worked perfectly in boiling my jars of tomatoes for canning. It actually worked better than my stove in the kitchen. I will be canning out on the back porch with this thing from now on.
customer_reviews.author: twalker

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove
customer_reviews.text: Went camping with this a couple weeks ago! Worked like a charm!! My only learning curve with it was how hot it got. Had to watch how high we kept the temp because it got hot fast (not complaining though!) we could eggs, and turkey bacon and boiled water for coffee every morning. Now I’m super thankful to have this contraption for when the power goes out! Why didn’t I think of this before?
customer_reviews.author: KateC

customer_reviews.title: Just like my old one
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this stove for 30 years and felt comfortable with it. So I decided to stay with this style stove. It works just like my old one. Others have reported trouble adjusting the the flame down to a low, simmer setting. But I had no problem at all setting it to a simmer, on either burner. Build quality was great. I hope to have this one for another 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: A nice stove for camping
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint with this stove it that the ignition button gets stuck inside the housing and you have to use a sharp object to pop it out from time to time. Other than that, it works great and almost as good as my home stove.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: You still need matches
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I bought this stove was for the ignition. It doesn't light. I have to use a lighter or match to light it. I wish I had saved the money and just got the one you have to light yourself. Do yourself a favor and save the cash. Buy the other one.
customer_reviews.author: jerseymama

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy. Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Used this product about 5 times before it failed completely. The arm that attaches to the propane failed to thread in. Once it finally did the copper line on the inside had a tear on it because it rotated as well and broke. Rendering the entire unit worthless. Do not buy. This is made poorly.
customer_reviews.author: joel vandenbrink

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: First time using it at a camp site it performed perfectly during a very windy/rainy evening...runs hot while cooking but I did not have any issues. Easy to clean and simple setup. I prefer the slightly larger size of this model but for campers trying to scale down on gear this is not the grill for you. Bought the Coleman carry bag that holds 2 propane tanks and the grill fits in it perfectly and can be hung up to keep it clean/safe.
customer_reviews.author: NSquared

customer_reviews.title: Worked great. Only issue is that the bottom is all ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Only issue is that the bottom is all metal which allows the stove to slide while trying to push the igniter button. Should have some rubber or something on the bottom to help keep it in one place. Other than that it worked great sithbcooking the pancakes, eggs and bacon and booking water for the dehydrated camping food we had.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: This is the camp stove to get!
customer_reviews.text: After 30 years, I decided to replace my Coleman stove. The Coleman Gas Camping Stove | Triton+ Propane Stove, 2 Burner is luxurious. Temp control, a built-in starter, and it's lighter and more compact than the older versions. I am delighted with my new stove, and hope to get another 30 years out of it.
customer_reviews.author: SandyM

customer_reviews.title: High heat or offf.
customer_reviews.text: If you only need to boil water this will work fine. Try to turn it down and it goes out. The ignitor requires a hard push and you must stabilize the stove to do it. This is way harder than using a lighter especially if the stove is already hot. Don't get this one, you will be sorry. I ordered another Classic to replace my old one and this is going back.
customer_reviews.author: DaReal

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Worked well with propane tank attachment on first couple uses anyway. Seems like it'll last awhile. Propane tank adapter hose can be stowed inside the closed stove. Probably would have given 5 stars, but the burner dial valves seem to open several turns while only the first 1/4 turn seems to actually adjust the flame. It's hard to see the flame in bright sunlight so I can't say positively that the extra turns don't give you more heat, but the dial labels suggest 1/4 turn is high.
customer_reviews.author: Latebrewer

customer_reviews.title: incomplete in original box
customer_reviews.text: received from amazon with missing control knobs--maybe a return resold as new? As other customers reported the metal case is out of square and wobbling /rocking on the table Poor manufacture reflets the price But on the positive side I was able to use my 20 pound propane tanks screw directly into the adaptor provided
customer_reviews.author: scammed customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with the quality of the product. It is portable, light weight and easy to use. Some have said that it is hard to turn down the heat. I will agree with that however it did wonderful on eggs, bacon, toast and coffee. As long as you are paying attention to your food and flame there should not be any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Verley

customer_reviews.title: Nice camping stove
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, thin, lightweight, sturdy HOWEVER it is VERY difficult to control the flame. It is either blast n burn or barely any and goes out. You must turn the knob slowly to adjust and its touchy. The igniter works well so no need for matches or batteries.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I agree with other reviews that some rubber pads on the bottom would be really great to prevent movement but just glue some on ya dummy ;)
customer_reviews.author: drumdrum

customer_reviews.title: Solid stove will get the job done. Great for camp trips.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grill, great for camping trips. But I took it out on my first trip and began using it only to discover that the right burner won’t start with a lighter or match being used during the spark process. The left lighting ignition works fine. Otherwise it’s a nice little stove for a good price. I wish they would do better quality checks to make sure that everything works as intended. Verify before use.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Klassen

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: This thing has one level: really f****in high. I can’t for the life of me figure out how to make the flame get any smaller than WAY TOO BIG. This thing goes all the way up to 11 but skips 1-10. You get the idea. We made some good food on it regardless, and loved how easy to set up and clean up it was.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Good stove
customer_reviews.text: Went camping for 4 days in Gore VA for my bachelor party this year, brought this for food. Cooked Chili and split pea soup in my cast iron Dutch oven, then steaks and potatoes for dinner, and eggs bacon and pancakes for breakfast in the cast skillet. Overall it did great. Temps are hard to get low, takes a careful hand to get the flame low without knocking it out entirely. Otherwise, this thing is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Loved using this stove!!! Worked great, folded up great, easy to use! My only thing is the knobs are a little tricky to use, it seems like it's all the way on or off. But it was my first time using it so I'll keep playing with it. Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Cross

customer_reviews.title: I asked for replacement hopefully the next one is better.
customer_reviews.text: As often the old brand names Coleman for quality is only history, this was very poorly built, the propane tube was so misaligned you could not screw it into the stove. I asked for replacement hopefully the next one is better.
customer_reviews.author: Randall A. Hillman

customer_reviews.title: Hotter than the temperature of the Sun
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, nice size. The only problem is the side farthest from the propane bottle is so hot it’s ridiculously hard to cook with cast iron. Burnt burnt burnt even removing the pan from the heat completely! Low is still blazing so I may pick up some stainless camp skillets that won’t retain the heat.
customer_reviews.author: joe forsythe

customer_reviews.title: Great Camping Stove
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale for $42 and this stove is a dream when I go camping. Everything works perfectly. Solid product. Well made. The ignitor switch is fantastic. It's nice to be able to start the burners without having to hunt for matches or a lighter. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Penne M.

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight and the instant ignition works flawless. ...
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and the instant ignition works flawless. Suggest purchasing an adapter hose and hooking up a larger propane tank if you are using this for longer than a weekend camping trip (will save you money in propane). Used it this past weekend on a camping excursion and convinced two other campers to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Josh S

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Father's Day gift for my husband. He was very happy to receive it and we had the opportunity to use it on a couple different camping trips over the summer. The InstaStart is nice to have and the wind shield works well. It cooked quickly and evenly. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LD315

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with a Coleman Stove....
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with a Coleman Stove. Works great....just like my old one that I gave to a friend to use and somehow it got lost. :) This new one replaced it and works great!
customer_reviews.author: Derrick

customer_reviews.title: I can not find one thing to fault. That ...
customer_reviews.text: I can not find one thing to fault. That alone is a rare thing these days. Very well thought out and designed. Solid, yet light weight construction. Push button ignition almost makes it too highly "civilized" for a mere "camp" stove. Wife says, " give it 8 stars." I Would if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Paul L. Worden

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: All good except for the low setting. Kinda tricky with the way the nobs are set up. Family said there was a little propane taste to some of the food. I've used better cooktops
customer_reviews.author: ThompsonLV

customer_reviews.title: Product not as sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stove to replace a current Coleman because it had the available griddle plate. I was surprised this item was not as sturdy and seemed to be flemsy compared to my current one. This item did not need my needs.
customer_reviews.author: teresa havens

customer_reviews.title: Good choice but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: It puts out a lot of heat but it would be nice if it had some sort of settings. It's hard to see the flame when you have a pan on top so it would be nice if the knob had setting indicators
customer_reviews.author: Bill D

customer_reviews.title: Good stove with a mediocre igniter
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time on a 2 day camping trip ... works exactly as described ... great stove cooks evenly .. powerful flames .. everything you could ask for .. even the wind panels work well ... definitely would have giving it 5/5 stars ... except the right burner only lit the first 2 times .. now doesn't light with the built in (snap style) igniter .. not a super big deal .. just make sure you bring matches or a lighter with you ..
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L

customer_reviews.title: Above Average camping stove
customer_reviews.text: The regulator has little control over the intensity of the flame. Flimsy product and thus makes it light weight. Easy to use and rocket science. One burner self ignites and the other doesn’t. Didn’t have time to investigate during camping, why. Recommend you carry a backup lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Shanicritique

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove did great in our spring camping trips. It is what I should be. The temperature control was a little precarious but overall a great stove
customer_reviews.author: Michel Slover

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, compact for travel. Def recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for camping. 2-burner stove is spacious enough to cook two things at once but compact for travel. It was my first time using a propane stove, and it was so easy! Solid, quality build. No issues. We look forward to a lot of trips work this going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill for the price no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill works great I recommend doing what I did and get the adapter hose and use a 20lb propane cylinder it makes this grill freaking tits.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: This is so easy to set up and ignite. The max flame output it very high and was able to boil water quickly even at 10k feet elevation. It’s lightweight and easy to carry as well.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, great working product
customer_reviews.text: Took on first camping trip and it works liked a gem! We had no issues with the push button, although I will say it did take a couple clicks to get the burners to lite - but nothing overly extreme. As any camper should, I would recommend to bring a lighter with you just in case you do have any issues. We look forward to using this for years. Any issues that arise I will be sure to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Guidotti

customer_reviews.title: Works great, lasting quality
customer_reviews.text: It works great! The ignition button is really hard to push which is my only complaint Update: I’m writing an update and increasing the stars to 5 because this stove has been a WORKHORSE!! I’m very pleased with how well it’s held up for 4 months of daily use, cooking for our family while our kitchen is being built.
customer_reviews.author: 7of14

customer_reviews.title: its litle havy
customer_reviews.text: Hard to control the flame You have to make sure you have your eyes on your food when you're cooking so you dont get your food burning
customer_reviews.author: Albass

customer_reviews.title: Triton camping stove #1
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing talk about a blast everything they said was true uses little less gas has a click starter never need matches again I'm really happy with this Triton propane camping stove five stars
customer_reviews.author: JOHN R !

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Both burners leaned to the right. Igniter on right side was bent. I fixed it myself, since I needed it in 2 days of receiving it. Crap made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great model, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Have also used the Coleman with the half grill and one burner and didn't like that model very much. Flow on grill side was not very adjustable and burned food. So I bought this instead and a light weight griddle. Impressed with this model. Flow is easy to adjust down low for the griddle usage and up high to boil water quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from our old green Coleman stove we used ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from our old green Coleman stove we used for 20 years (now donated to the local Cub Scout Pack) nice feature having a spot for the griddle. You do give up some space on the griddle vs. the older stoves but the hotter burners, integrated storage and self ignition make it worth the trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to control temp
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to setup and take down. The thermostat sucks. It has two settings: the sun and just barely on.
customer_reviews.author: Itsme

customer_reviews.title: Was not like new.
customer_reviews.text: Defective right burner didn't light. Body has crack. Is also greasey.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya T.

customer_reviews.title: Click button lighter does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go Camping tomorrow but I just tried it and the click button lighter doesn’t work at least I tried it before I went camping... that was he only reason I chose this one
customer_reviews.author: Churchy

customer_reviews.title: Great Cooking stove, easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: Love this stove. Just need to get an adapter hose and regulator so I can use the big propane bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Knight

customer_reviews.title: It's a Coleman!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, flame goes low enough to fry/scramble eggs without sticking or burning. Boils water quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: A camping must have....
customer_reviews.text: Love this stove. First one I've owned and 2nd one my wife has used. It's awesome and cuts cooking time/making coffee in half or less.
customer_reviews.author: David Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Did not work. Test as soon as you receive.
customer_reviews.text: It did not work. I made the mistake of waiting until I went camping to use it. Sucks !
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great Stove
customer_reviews.text: I use this at the campsite, works, dependable, easy to simmer or cook on high.

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra cash and get this quality one

customer_reviews.title: The flames are true and the controls are just perfect. I saw a few other brands that had ...
customer_reviews.text: There is something to be said about "Test of Time." Coleman is definitely a brand to trust. This is very reliable and I have no doubt that it will last long enough for me to hand it down to my kid, and then some. The flames are true and the controls are just perfect. I saw a few other brands that had sharp edges unlike this Coleman Triton. I would recommend this not only to first timers but to seasoned campers.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my fiancé for Father’s Day. We love to camp and this has been so perfect for our camping trips!! It’s so easy to use, easy to transport, and everything he makes has been delicious! Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Charli

customer_reviews.title: No heat regulation
customer_reviews.text: Having had Coleman stoves most of my life, (my last one lasted 30 years), I had to get a Coleman stove again. There are things that I like and things I don't like. The splash plate under the burners is nice. Makes for easy cleanup. It is also light weight, easy to light and overall I like it. My big concern is the heat adjustment. There isn't any. It seems to be only hot or off. If I just need a low flame I can't figure out how to get it. There is no heat regulation. I find that very frustrating as I don't like to cook everything on high heat.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but no temperature control.
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated there really is no control over heat levels. It’s either scorching hot or you turn it off. The control knobs spin but do nothing. So after a scorched griddle replacement, Ive learned to have a hot side and a cool side and to CONSTANTLY move the food around.

product_meta.title: Coleman Gas Camping Stove | Triton+ Propane Stove, 2 Burner
product_meta.description: Take your outdoor cooking to the next level with the Coleman Triton+ Propane Gas Camping Stove, 2-Burner. Hit the push-button ignition for matchless lighting, and you'll be cooking with up to 22,000 total BTUs of power in no time. Adjustable wind-blocking panels shield burners from the wind.
feature_bullets: COOKING POWER: Up to 22,000 total BTUs
2 ADJUSTABLE BURNERS: For precise temperature control
WIND-BLOCKING PANELS: Shield burners from wind and adjust for various pan sizes
PRESSURE REGULATOR: Pressure-control technology for consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
EASY TO CLEAN: Chrome-plated grate and rust-resistant aluminum cooktop
